messages.message: I'll certainly consider it. Do you have any specific requests in mind regarding the Balkans and Black Sea?

messages.message: I'd rather we didn't bounce in the black sea - If you move your fleet to Constantinople then you can get it out into the Mediterranean really quickly, to both of our benefits.
messages.input: My response to TURKEY:'I'd rather we didn't bounce in the black sea - If you move your fleet to Constantinople then you can get it out into the Mediterranean really quickly, to both of our benefits.'.

messages.message: I'm not sure I know you well enough yet to just hand you the black sea, though. What's in it for me?
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'I'm not sure I know you well enough yet to just hand you the black sea, though. What's in it for me?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. TURKEY's response shows a level of skepticism and reluctance to fully trust your intentions, indicating a need for further convincing or assurance of the benefits of the proposed move before committing to it.

messages.message: Rumania? I'll support you in.
messages.input: My response to TURKEY:'Rumania? I'll support you in.'.

messages.message: If you want me to have Rumania (and presumably you don't want to take any of my holdings), what use is it to be in the Black sea anyway?
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'If you want me to have Rumania (and presumably you don't want to take any of my holdings), what use is it to be in the Black sea anyway?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. TURKEY's response indicates a logical inconsistency in questioning the purpose of having the Black Sea if they are not interested in holding Rumania, suggesting a possible attempt to challenge or probe the reasoning behind your proposals.

messages.message: I'm imagining your being in Rumania as a short-term trust-building sort of thing. You're in there for a year, maybe two tops, and you get builds from that that allow you to build more fleets to flood the Med, and I get the long-term comfort of not worrying about you going to BLA. Once we start picking up Italian/Austrian dots, we can trade Rumania back to me to keep some parity going.
messages.input: My response to TURKEY:'I'm imagining your being in Rumania as a short-term trust-building sort of thing. You're in there for a year, maybe two tops, and you get builds from that that allow you to build more fleets to flood the Med, and I get the long-term comfort of not worrying about you going to BLA. Once we start picking up Italian/Austrian dots, we can trade Rumania back to me to keep some parity going.'.
